hypothesis_content.title: SOL Volatility Regime Shift Following ETF Flow Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: A daily net inflow into SOL-based ETFs (e.g., $750M referenced in news) that is 2 standard deviations above its 20-day average, while BTC ETF flows are neutral or negative, will cause SOL's 10-day implied volatility (IV) to rise by at least 15% relative to BTC's 10-day IV over the following week.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Asymmetric, strong ETF inflows into a major altcoin like SOL signal a dedicated risk-on rotation and new, potentially less stable, capital entering the asset. This should increase demand for options (raising IV) and likely lead to higher realized volatility as price discovers new levels.
entry_conditions: SOL ETF daily net inflow > (20-day avg + 2*std)
Current SOL 10-day IV / BTC 10-day IV ratio < 1.3
Enter long SOL volatility/short BTC volatility (volatility spread) at next open

exit_conditions.take_profit: SOL/BTC 10-day IV ratio increases by 0.15 (e.g., from 1.2 to 1.35)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The SOL/BTC IV ratio fails to increase by at least 10% within 7 days in over 55% of qualifying events.
